column4: Hey. How would I mount a fat32 partition with read/write manually?
man mount. Look for filesystem type vfat.
I have it mounted. I just can't write to it.
/dev/sda4 /media/Music vfat user,auto 0 0   Thats how it is. But I cannot write to it.
That looks fine. Try unmount it and mount it again. Its possible it failed fsck in the bootup sequence and remounted read-only.
sudo mount -a  okay?
umount /dev/sda4. Then run mount -a. Shouldn't need sudo as you have it set to user.
It says I need to be root to unmount it...
Then sudo umount /dev/sda4.
Still can't write to it.
fsck it
fsck /dev/sda ?
sda4*
yes
Still can't write :S
What error message does it give you?
When trying to write to it?
Yes. You're just saying it doesn't work, without giving details.
Error while copying to "/media/Music". You do not have permissions to write to this folder.
The fsck did work. No errors. But I still cant write to it.
Okay, well that's different. sudo umount /dev/sda4. mount /dev/sda4 (as you, not root!)
I still can't. Same thing
Try adding the option umask=666 to the fstab. And make sure you are not mounting it as root.
There are some pretty good manuals for this sort of thing. Try google your problem and read through what you find.
